page.title: 09EDUCATION IN SHERIFF HUTTON
page.content: Pre-school children attend playgroup in the village hall,the five to eleven year olds have a purpose built County Primary School in the village,and the older children travel by school buses to Easingwold Secondary School.There are several schools in the area offering a variety of evening adult education courses.The village school, opened 1965,draws children from Sherrif Hutton,Lilling,Stittenham, Whenby,Skewsby and Dalby.They are divided by age in four classes. Three classrooms and hall in the main building and one temporary classroom on the playing field.School has its own kichen,children can also take packed lunches.The school aims to bring each child to an awareness of the world around him or her and equip them,to the best of there ability to play a full part in it.
